_comment: Created by ianb on 27/06/2014 16:16:17 using v2.1
title: How have regional employment gaps changed?
analysis_commentary: In 2006/07 Q2 - the first quarter for which data are available - the difference between employment rates for people with LTCs and the general population varied by region, from 11% in the south east to 21% in Merseyside. The narrowing of the national gap in employment for people with LTCs between 2006 and 2010 was reflected by falls in all regions of England, though reductions were greater in some regions than others. For example, the eastern region fell from 13% to 8% at the end of 2010/11, and Merseyside experiencing a 8% reduction. Since 2011, gaps in all areas have increased again, though in most cases were still lower in 2013/14 Q3 than they were in 2006/07 Q2. In most regions the gap increased at similar rates, although Merseyside appeared increase much more sharply.
